remarks: Equivalence between two ways of expressing ` B ` as an affine combination of ` A ` and ` C ` .  (Contributed by David Moews, 28-Feb-2017.)
statement:
affineequiv.A $e |- ( ph -> A e. CC ) $.
affineequiv.B $e |- ( ph -> B e. CC ) $.
affineequiv.C $e |- ( ph -> C e. CC ) $.
affineequiv.D $e |- ( ph -> D e. CC ) $.
affineequiv2 $p |- ( ph -> ( B = ( ( D x. A ) + ( ( 1 - D ) x. C ) ) <-> ( B - A ) = ( ( 1 - D ) x. ( C - A ) ) ) ) $.
